title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not provide both the correct answer and a valid justification, based on bonding type, equivalent to one of the following.

· Agree. The reaction of a metal with a highly electronegative nonmetal (nitrogen) will produce an ionic bond.

OR

· Disagree. Spectrum #3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbtv2zVvgiqjxAUrharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeGaeaaakeaacaGGJaGaaG4maaaa@3A5F@ corresponds to Al MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbtv2zVvgiqjxAUrharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeGaeaaakeaacaqGbbGaaeiBaaaa@3AAE@ , and the compound AlN MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbtv2zVvgiqjxAUrharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeGaeaaakeaacaqGbbGaaeiBaiaab6eaaaa@3B7F@ demonstrates significant covalent character.

title: Part F
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not provide both the correct diagram choice and a valid justification, based on number of peaks and relative position of reactant and product energies, equivalent to the following.

· Diagram 1. The potential energy of the products is higher than that of the reactants, which is consistent with an endothermic reaction. The diagram also has two peaks, corresponding to a two-step mechanism.

The response includes both the correct diagram choice and a valid justification, based on number of peaks and relative position of reactant and product energies, equivalent to the following.

· Diagram 1. The potential energy of the products is higher than that of the reactants, which is consistent with an endothermic reaction. The diagram also has two peaks, corresponding to a two-step mechanism.

title: Part I
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not provide both the correct answer and a valid justification, based on average speed presented in the plot, equivalent to the following.

· Z has a molar mass greater than that of R. Since the curve for Z is shifted further to the left, and the average speed is lower, a particle of Z must be more massive than a particle of R. According to KMT MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbtv2zVvgiqjxAUrharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeGaeaaakeaacaqGlbGaaeytaiaabsfaaaa@3B70@ , more massive particles with the same average kinetic energy (temperature) move with lower average speed.

The response gives both the correct answer and a valid justification, based on average speed presented in the plot, equivalent to the following.

· Z has a molar mass greater than that of R. Since the curve for Z is shifted further to the left, and the average speed is lower, a particle of Z must be more massive than a particle of R.
